sentences: Paremal laius põld, vasakul mustas mets.
context: Paremal is an Estonian adverb meaning 'on the right' or 'to the right'. It's used to indicate position relative to something on the right side. In the example sentences, it shows someone sitting to the right of me ('Ta istus minust paremal'), a field lying to the left with forest to the right ('Paremal laius põld, vasakul mustas mets'), and a car parked on the right side of the road ('Auto parkis paremal pool teed'). The word 'paremal' often appears in phrases like 'paremal pool' meaning 'on the right side'.
